stability.unstable: ðŸ”¬ This is a nightly-only experimental API.  (exact_chunks #47115)

apiDescription: An iterator over a slice in (non-overlapping) chunks (chunk_size elements at a time).
When the slice len is not evenly divided by the chunk size, the last up to chunk_size-1 elements will be omitted but can be retrieved from the remainder function from the iterator.
This struct is created by the exact_chunks method on slices.

trait implementations.name: impl<'a, T> std::iter::Iterator for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::iter::DoubleEndedIterator for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::clone::Clone for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::iter::TrustedLen for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::fmt::Debug for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T> where T: 'a + std::fmt::Debug
impl<'a, T> std::iter::ExactSizeIterator for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::iter::FusedIterator for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T>
impl<'a, T> std::marker::Send for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T> where T: std::marker::Sync
impl<'a, T> std::marker::Sync for std::slice::ExactChunks<'a, T> where T: std::marker::Sync

methods.name: pub fn remainder(&self) -> &'a [T]
